primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human struggle for meaning and survival amidst universal suffering, where the believer avoids 'defeat' through the possession of a 'treasure' (Jesus).

tekstueel_bewijs: You and I will never understand... until we see it as a struggle
We get hurt, run risks, and must struggle
find out what life is all about
the difference between winning and losing
the riddle is put to us in the events of our existence
He was enthroned by a grateful citizenry
Every Christian can be confident of such an outcome
the gospel which put joy bells ringing

tegenstander.identificatie: Suffering, Sin, and the 'Cruel Sphinx' of Life
tekstueel_bewijs: the cruel Sphinx would devour a human soul
brutal cruelty of the most ruthless empire
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as an ontological 'riddle' and a 'universal heritage of woe' that threatens to 'devour' the soul.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Enlistment' program: Joining God's army to ensure personal victory.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary struggle on earth leads to the secondary reward in heaven, provided the subject 'enlists'.

voorbeelden: trying to find what this life is all about
You will never understand... until we see it as a struggle
The man who wrote my text knew what it's all about
Are you able to see a design?

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is Gnostic-therapeutic; it assumes that 'knowing' the nature of the struggle and 'possessing' the antidote (Jesus) provides the power to endure.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Sphinx/Woe) to ~S1 (Struggle) to ~S2 (Resilience) to S1 (Coronation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Victory is achieved by the human subject using Jesus as a resource to bounce back from the 'knockdowns' of life.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Suffering is described with visceral intensity.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the language is highly 'Christian,' the actantial subject is consistently 'We.' Jesus is the 'antidote' or 'treasure' that *we* have, which enables *us* to win. It is a 'Theology of Glory' disguised as a 'Theology of the Cross.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The difference between winning and losing in his life was Jesus Christ.
Christians are like rubber balls. The harder you throw them down, the higher they bounce.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: We have this treasure in earthen vessels.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is presented as the ultimate 'winner' who survived the 'University of Hard Knocks' through his faith.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Paul was not a 'winner' but a man being 'always given over to death' so that the life of Jesus (the true Subject) might be revealed.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'bounce back' and 'enlist' to ensure personal victory.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God provides the 'antidote,' but the human must 'carry the cross' and 'march on' to win.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative is coherent as a 'Hero's Journey' where the hero uses a divine tool.
spanning_punten: The text says 'treasure in earthen vessels' (God's power in our weakness), but the sermon interprets it as 'rubber balls' (our inherent resilience because of the treasure).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In Jesus we shall triumph over every foe... we who enlist in his army are going to win.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'treasure' is a static possession rather than a dynamic Person (Spirit) acting.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is listed alongside 'sickness' and 'sorrow' as a life-hurdle rather than a state of death requiring resurrection.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a motivational speech where God is the 'Helper' and the Believer is the 'Subject' of the victory.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The believer is the one 'winning' and 'bouncing.'
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ is the one who wins *for* and *in* the failing believer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We shall overcome,' use 'Christ has overcome the world that is crushing us.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Earthen Vessel' (cracked and dying).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the 'death' in the text so that the 'life of Jesus' is the only acting force.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Pouvoir (God's power in our total inability).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the 'vessel' has no power to bounce; it only holds the power of Another.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already takes suffering seriously; it just provides a human-centered solution.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (struggling well) is fused with Soteriology (winning).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology: Christ's victory over our death. Ethics: Our weak participation in His life.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has great rhetorical power and empathy, but it risks burdening the hearer with the task of 'not losing' instead of the comfort of being 'found' by the One who already won.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a masterpiece of empathy; actantially, it is a burden of performance.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of 2 Cor 4 usually emphasizes the 'death of Jesus' in the body; the sermon emphasizes the 'victory' of the believer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite using 'Jesus' as a keyword, the 'Subject' slot is occupied by the human ego.

appendices.notities: The 'Rubber Ball' metaphor is the semiotic key: it defines the believer's nature as inherently resilient when 'thrown down,' which contradicts the 'Earthen Vessel' (fragile/breakable) metaphor of the actual text.
